The aroma is a heavenly marriage of lime zest and orange marmalade with notes of soft spices. This citrusy brew has a silky body and finishes off very dry with a mild bite, making Pride a refreshing beer for any occasion.

Mosaic hops were added in the whirlpool and dry hop to compliment the tropical notes, before shit loads of Mango, Habanero chili, Basil and Mint were added to the beer. 

The Habaneros are very aromatic in a fruity sense, and adds just a touch of bite without being SPICY! Salt was also added to enhance the savoury notes in place of fish sauce. 

May we add that the colour is simply lovely!
A New England style IPA, heavy handed in the whirlpool and double dry hopped with Citra and Chinook hops. Hazy, juicy and piney, with a soft bitterness and mouthfeel to support.

Saison, a forgotten and under appreciated beer was once served to refresh and replenish farmhouse workers in Belgium. We've added a modern twist to this refreshing ale, with bright floral, bubblegum and white pepper notes from our farmhouse yeast blend, and topped it off with Mosaic in the dry hop. Dry, Crisp, Hoppy, Saison is making a Resurgence!

JUICE JUICE JUICE!!! That's how we'd describe this NE-VERSARY IPA, our big, hazy, and juicy 6th anniversary NEIPA. Here, we switched things up and dry-hopped this twice with Cashmere, Vista and Mosaic hops—Cashmere flourishes in this hop-forward brew giving delicate yet strong fruity notes of lemon, lime, melon, and tangerine, Vista lends a ripe honeydew, papaya, and white peach aroma, while Mosaic rounds it all up with sweet and tropical fruity notes of passionfruit, lime and blueberry. If that doesn't sound delicious to you, read it again. We kid, but thank you for your company thus far, we hope you like what we've done, and cheers to our 6th birthday together!

Drink Category: IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy
Official Description:
Admit it, the best part of drinking an IPA is the Hop Burp that comes after—which may or may not be the reason for the name of our brew, go figure.

Brewed with experimental hops HBC 586 and HBC 522, Hop Burp is a juicy NEIPA bursting with an abundance of fresh pine needles and citrus grapefruit notes, accompanied by a fruity medley of mango, guava and lychee aroma. You know what? You're going to look forward to your next burp with this one.

Acid Hop brings together things we enjoy in an IPA and a Berliner Weisse, loads of hops and a refreshing tartness! Hopped heavily with Citra and Chinook, pineapples were added to this sour ale to create enjoyable Sour IPA for anytime of the day.

Back with a fresh new collab with our Thai buddies, The Brewing Project, Phaya Red IPA boasts of a solid carared, crystal and munich malt backbone, that gives it the robust, warm, red hue to the pour. 

Hopped with a series of American hops—Centennial, Chinook, Columbus, Mosaic, Sabro, Simcoe and HBC 586, Phaya Red IPA is an intensely tropical, citrusy with fresh pine aroma, that's dank yet well-balanced. 

Fun fact: Phaya is the Thai word for leader, sovereign. So... ?

Metaverse, ready yourself for our latest Scale Ale, that's here to demolish cities with larger-than-life pixel beasts! A first-of-its-kind NFT collaboration brew from Singapore, we've teamed up with the good people behind KaijuKingz—who by the way, is one of the top 60 most traded NFT Collection on the blockchain—to birth an ale fit for the Kingz ?

A no-expense-spared New England IPA, Scale Ale is a big, juicy, and supremely hoppy pour that's brewed with a generous amount of Mosaic, HBC586, and Vic Secret hops, which imparts citrus and tropical aromas such as pineapple, passionfruit, mango guava, and lychee. Within, you'll also find pine-needle fragrance, finishing with a soft bitterness mouthfeel.

Here’s a lil’ something we did with our Thai friends, SAMATA and The Brewing Project, last month—say hello to Three Way IPA, where three distinctive brewing cultures meet.

A solid modern West Coast IPA with a clean malt profile, which allows for the Sabro and HBC 586 hops to shine through. With this, we’re going back to basics with a simply delicious IPA. Forget the hype, enjoy the brew.

Inspired by some mutant Seagulls on the prowl, The Fringe Project 004 is Brewlander's twisted Best Bitter brewed with Floor Malted Maris Otter and Loral, Palisade and Celeia hops. Drink up fast, before them gulls fight you for it.

Celebrating the end of masks and the return of travel in the best way possible - with a collaboration brew with our good friends in Australia, Rocky Ridge Brewing Co! Face 2 Face IPA is an all out sensory assault that promises to keep you OFF the edge. Expect a hoppy and tropical pour that is extremely smashable, like your laptop on its 3483498 attempt to get a video call working. With this in hand, it's time to say goodbye to screens and our "favourite" phrase, 'can you hear me?'!

With each sip, you'll be greeted by a kaleidoscope of tropical fruit notes. Juicy mango, zesty citrus, and luscious passion fruit dance across your palate. Truly, a cosmic explosion for every palate.

A west coast inspired experiment of the TFP 008 NEIPA, have taken on a life of it's own. Using the Azacca, Centennial and Chinook hops, with a West Coast like malt bill, water profile and hopping schedule, expect the beer to be juicy, piney and slightly resinous, with a firmer bitterness and a crisp mouthfeel.

This beer made John break his promise of not brewing a West Coast IPA!

Commemorating SG’s 58th Celebration, we created a Red India Pale Ale that boasts of a solid Maris Otter, backbone and further supported by Munich, Carared and a touch of Chocolate malt that gives its red hue. Hopped with a series of New World hops —Chinook, Citra, Eclipse, HBC 586 and Summit this beer is intensely citrusy with a fresh pine aroma that's dank as a solid West Coast Style IPA should be!

TFP 006 is a supercharged Export Porter inspired by local homebrewer DQ's award winning Milk Stout. We roped in the talented folks from Fossa Chocolate, who roasted a special blend of cacao nibs for this collaboration. 006 is truly delicious Chocolate Coconut Porter, further supported with Vanilla and Hazelnut. Yummy!!

旺来 (Ong Lai), which means incoming fortune, can also be read as Pineapple in the Cantonese and Hokkien dialect. That’s why, you'll find an abundance of pineapples notes in the aromatic brew, that finishes with a gentle and clean bitterness alongside a silky mouthfeel.

No, you'll not be getting a literal frostnip but you’ll be pleasantly surprised when you have this. Just imagine—with each sip, you’ll get all the glorious hop aroma an IPA promises, but with a crisp, fresh pine, and clean bitterness to finish. This is done by fermenting it to a very low final gravity with lager yeast, alongside the addition of Amarillo, Galaxy and HBC 586 hops, allowing its' flavourful hoppy oils, and punchy, citrus-like, sweet fruit aroma to shine through. A perfect starting drink, just a tiny frostnip.

Sourpocalypse offers a perfect balance of sweetness and tartness, The aroma is bursting with vibrant mango notes.

On the palate, the beer is incredibly well-balanced, with neither the sweetness nor the tartness overpowering the other. The mango and grapefruit flavors dance together harmoniously, creating a delightfully refreshing taste experience that will leave you wanting more.

PROFILE: Mango, grapefruit, smoothie-like
Seasonal release at Brewlalah Craft Beer Festival Volume 1.

Expression Name: Other Side of A Black Hole
Official Description:
Other Side Of A Black Hole is an experimental project we had in mind for awhile. Brewed with the heritage Chevallier malt, a forgotten malt that was revered during Victorian times, it gives a robust malt foundation with a rich marmalade character and a long finish, further complemented by a smooth espresso from our favourite roasted malts.

We didn’t stop there and went a step further to dry hop this with HBC 472, an experimental hop that imparts oak, coconut and vanilla flavours that would trick you into believing this was bourbon barrel aged! Enjoy and cherish this luscious beer, cause there's so few of this going around.

Is this love, or am I dreaming? ? This is a cheeky one—both the brew and the name! Hopped with your old school West Coast hops (read: Chinook, Centennial, Simcoe), giving this pour a stone fruit citrus aroma and piney fragrance. A rather hazy-looking brew, we wonder if this is an offspring of Love Wild IPA? Hmm. Either way, it's one you definitely wanna try!

What's guanabana - you must be thinking that. It's a mysterious tropical fruit that smells like pineapple and tastes like strawberries and apples, but tart. Any guesses? Soursop. Combined with our ester-driven gose that is lemony sour, with a touch of saltiness from sour plums, making this a refreshing, subtly sweet, and elegantly sour pour that keeps you coming back for more.

Alright here goes, meet our 'Best Dad Award IPA', for the superhero dad who works hard, in more than one way. A piney, bright and tropical brew infused with Horny Goat Weed - THE supplement that keeps on giving, it promises to treat nerve pains, fatigue, osteoporosis, and of course, increase one's blood flow and performance ? Psst, expect a subtle herbaceous note from the Horny Goat Weed!

a throwback to the classic danky IPAs of the West Coast. Born and brewed in the far west of sunny Singapore, we couldn't help but wonder - why would any bird want to lay eggs here? Yet, despite the odds, we've managed to create something crisp, refreshing and aromatic.

Whether you're exploring tuas jungle or escaping to WEST COAST BEACH, this beer is sure to quench your thirst and satisfy your taste buds.

Inspired by the unforgettable team bonding trip (no, it wasn't to Geylang) of our brewing crew, I'm a fruity Hazy IPA that exudes passion in every sip. With the exotic allure of passionfruit and aromatic hops, I unleash a fruit-forward explosion on your palate. My subtle citrus notes add a delightful tanginess that tangos with the sweetness of the passionfruit, giving you a palate-kicking experience that will leave you craving for more.

Be warned! My passion might be dangerous to your wallet, but I'd say it's a risk worth taking.

Alison, I'll drink your wine is specifically designed to showcase the unique flavors of hop thiols. Thiols, for those who might not know, are a type of sulfur compound that occur naturally in hops. They're responsible for the distinctive tropical fruit flavors and aromas that have become synonymous with modern hoppy beers. we've managed to coax out these thiols in all their glory, resulting in a beer that's both complex and delicious.

Profile: Tropical, Passionfruit, White Grape

Rumble in the Jungle, a 3-way collab stout Brewlander x Jungle Beer x Smith Street Taps, offers a velvety-smooth mouthfeel with a well-balanced blend of roasted malt sweetness, hints of dark chocolate, and a subtle coffee-like aromas from both the roasted grains and chicory. The chicory imparts an intriguing complexity to the beer, contributing a mild earthy bitterness and a touch of spice that lingers on the palate. The goal was to create an inimitable Maibock style lager beer brewed using the best honey we could find. The result is a sublime but punchy Maibock with extra character and drinkability. This beer opens up with an abundance of bright floral notes followed by deep malt character and a long finish. At 7% abv, it drinks really smooth and is the perfect FESTBIER for Smith Street Tap's momentous anniversary. 

Cheers to many more good years!

Brewed in collaboration with our friends at Harland Brewing Co, San Diego, CA. A full on candy experience made with Georgian pomegranates, Southeast Asian mangosteens and a shower of marshmallows to round off this trans-pacific collaboration. Is this a cocktail or beer? You decide!

Straight up spiced pineapple beach vibes from the liberal use of BRU-1 hops in our latest NEIPA. The mouthfeel is rich, creamy and deep with a piney and long lasting finish.

A once off special collaboration with our good friends at Smith Street Taps to celebrate their 9th Year Anniversary.

Brewed with classic West Coast hops that brought IPAs to eminence and kickstarted the modern craft beer movement. We chose a pale malt base with just a touch of malty backbone to accentuate the bold, citrusy and piney flavours from our blend of hops. The result is an unabashedly flavourful IPA which is superbly well balanced and pleasing to both IPA enthusiasts and anyone new to the style. Cheers to 9 years and more!
Every dog has its day! Our brand new West Coast style Double IPA is brimming with familiar piney resinous flavours alongside a juicy citrus forward mid-palate. This might be the winning recipe :)

A special edition of our crowd favourite False Sense of Security. As with the original version, this beer is extremely sessionable, but we upped the ante and supercharged the mouthfeel and used a crazy blend of 6 hops to showcase an exuberant burst of hop flavours.

Winter ale sprinkled with our blend of festive spices and topped with a rich impression of dark plums and sweet prunes, rounding off with a warming finish for the year end holidays.

Official Description: The second beer in our new style of hazy DIPAs - expect a riot of tropical fruits such as mango, passionfruit and stone fruits alongside an ultra balanced creamy smooth mouthfeel.
Chocolate Imperial Stout. Decadent notes of Belgian chocolate, caramel, and warming roastiness.

What happens when the major flavor universes of Dank and Juice collide? Reverse Juice is born! It’s packed with bright flavors of ripened stone fruits and citrus but with an equal measure of dank earthy goodness - a beautiful reflection of our inspiration: the sun-kissed lands of Southwest USA.

Brewed exclusively for Smith Street Taps' 8th year anniversary in collaboration with Lion City Meadery. 

Out of The Woods is multidimensional and superlative, combining a traditional Belgian Saison beer with honey from Lion City Meadery and subsequently conditioned on agave oak. 

The result is far more than the parts, exhibiting bucolic farmhouse ale flavors tightly wound with honey and creamy oak in a spectacularly layered imperial strength beer. 

Expect nothing less as we emerge out of the woods!

Version 2 of Modern West features an improved hop profile as well as a crisper mouthfeel. Flavour notes include tropical fruits, pine resin, citrus and white fruits with a punchy and really clean finish.

A really fun and exciting beer made in collaboration with Smith Street Taps for their 7th year anniversary. This IPA is nothing like we’ve ever drank or made before. Encouraged by the pioneering team behind Smith Street Taps, we concocted a seemingly incoherent yeast blend using 2 yeasts which are complete polar opposites of one another - 70% blend of a yeast which ferments crisp and clean, and 30% with a yeast known to produce beers with a fruity and slightly sweet profile. 

An eclectic mix of hops was chosen - Jester for bittering, Azacca and Riwaka for aroma. A judicious amount of restraint was applied when deciding the hop dosage; just about right to deliver a sublimely hoppy IPA in perfect harmony with the malt and yeast profile.

The 4th iteration of our Magic Technique series featuring one of the best fruit combinations ever. This exotic duo of Kiwi and Strawberry perfectly complement each other in a delicious and intriguing way, try it to find out!

The persistence of memory; a year ago, we sampled an up and coming experimental hop in Nuremberg during the BrauBeviale trade show on a research trip to Europe. The hop was HBC692 / also known as Talus. Back then, we knew that we needed to make an IPA with this hop which exhibited very unique flavours. 

Up front, you will be greeted with an intoxicating incense-like flavour, followed by dried muscatel, earthy dankness and subtle spice notes. Hop bitterness is firm to round things off leaving you with a long finish. 

Well, we bided our time to make this beer so its your turn to enjoy it now!

Brewed exclusively for Good Luck Beerhouse's 4th year anniversary. We made this with lots of Middle Eastern dates and added a potent spice mixture by the amazing people of Good Luck Beerhouse and Ah Sam Cold Drink Stall. The result is a phenomenal beer, fit for the special occasion.

A sublime hazy pale ale made with premium pale malts and a blend of the most flavoursome hops we could find from the US, New Zealand and Australia. 

This beer redefines what a pale ale should be with a smooth and light body alongside bright flavours of tropical, citrus and stonefruit.

A lusciously delicious beer brimming with sweet intoxicating flavours of strawberries and cream: made with whole and pureed strawberries, a sprinkling of lactose, a dash of vanilla and an experimental hop variety = to lots of love! Saranghae!

Featuring a bounty of raspberry and morello cherries. Fresh sweetness and soft tartness from ripe raspberries tempered with the deep richness of morello cherries makes this beer an intense fruity experience.

Conjured in our minds and made with an amalgamation of brewing techniques, Collected Fiction is decidedly sour yet impeccably soft with jammy berries intertwined with a smooth yoghurt flavour. An underlying malt character completes this almost fictional experience. Is it still a beer, we wonder?

Do you know the origins of Nutella? Our pastry porter is inspired by the classic Italian combination of hazelnut praline and chocolate combined to make Gianduja. A silky smooth package wraps the palate with roasty coffee laced with chocolate and finishes with a creamy, satisfying texture.

Official Description:
Super limited New England Double IPA featuring Chinook hops from Michigan. 

Terroir matters when it comes to hop varieties. Traditionally, Chinook hops are grown in Washington State of the US and they are known to deliver a resinous and piney flavour. However, when grown in Michigan State, they express a completely different flavour profile with bright pineapple, grapefruit and resin notes.

We were able to brew with this hop in our signature New England Double IPA base which really accentuates the rich body, bright tropical fruit flavours with a piney finish.

Crisp, refreshing beer brewed for the hot equatorial climate. Single, dry-hopped Citra gives notes of passionfruit, citrus and lychee. Well-balanced with dry golden tones and a crisp, clean finish. An exceptionally sessionable beer.
Island Lager is a thirst-quenching beer made for every occasion. Clean, crisp and dry-hopped with Hallertau Blanc for a light elderflower aroma, it's a smooth drinking, highly sinkable lager.

Mosaic, daughter of Simcoe and Nugget: the beautifully blended hop that changed beer for the better. This single-hopped IPA champions notes of mango and citrus, as well as Mosaic's signature infusion of berry-medley aromas. The Boss melds all the above into a finely balanced beer, packed with flavours that linger on the palate. Picture Perfect.

Our Kolsch is a summer ale with a crisp, refreshing edge. Presenting a subtle hop character, low malt body and a fragrant aroma of pear and apple, we've dosed in Hallertau Tradition hops paired with specialty Kveik yeast. A unique version of this classic Köln brew. Tastes of happiness.

Chock-full of Citra and Simcoe hops with a little kicker of Cascade, you can expect a resinous pine, ripe mango and citrus fiesta of fun on your taste buds. A balanced bitterness allows the hop notes to shine, and the refined characteristics of the crystal malt carry the body to a lovely malt cracker finish.

Originally brewed to commemorate Earth Day, such was the popularity of our Nitro Stout that we brought it into our core range. With its roasted malt aromas and low hop bitterness, this is universally acclaimed as a delicious, easy-going beer.

This Cold-IPA will breathe new life into your love of beer, thanks to the magnificent Cryo Pop hops, which delivers supercharged tropical and stone fruit flavours. As fresh and exhilarating as a frosty morning, and the perfect counterweight to Singapore Christmas weather. We’re warning you: once you pop this beer, you’ll find it very hard to put down.

A beer fit for a rockstar. Our Double IPA is packed with Zappa Hops, named after the legendary musician Frank Zappa and embodied with the same rebellious spirit. Mildly spicy, with strong notes of tropical fruits on the tongue and pinewood and light mint aroma. Brewed using Kveik speciality yeast. Exceptional chilled haze for your drinking pleasure.

This beautiful Berliner Weisse is bursting with bright raspberry flavours that are balanced with a zippy and dry tartness. The puréed fresh raspberries lend a pillowy cloudiness to the body and produce a refreshing finish. A fruited sour at it's finest!

The Singapore Nutmeg Stout is a limited-edition, seasonal collaboration brew with London Beer Factory, brewed in London, UK. An indulgent Imperial Stout, containing hand-picked Singaporean nutmeg, and Madagascan vanilla and cacao nibs soaked in bourbon. A strong grain profile of malted barley and oats, brewed with lactose for a rich and creamy finish. This robust stout is an age-old recipe, crafted with a modern asian twist.

An extraordinarily good English Ordinary Bitter. Woody and earthy, with delicate notes of honey and thyme and a malt-driven body, our English Bitter is single-hopped at three stages with East Kent Golding, a truly classic British hop. This chestnut-coloured ale is smooth on the palate and possesses a wonderfully dry finish. Staggeringly sessionable.

A confluence of our English Bitter and Leon De Oro, we present to you our Bearskin Bitter - an Old Blighty brew that's true to style. With a warm toffee malt aroma, our Bearskin Bitter is gently carbonated (like any good E.O.B) and hopped with both El Dorado and East Kent Golding for notes of honey with a hint of thyme. A wonderful take on a true English classic, it fits as snug in your hand as a Bearskin on a guard's head!

A sultry beer made for Singapore's endless summer, our Two To Mango combines full fruity aromas with a subtle sweetness and dry finish. Juicy, thirst-quenching, and refreshingly balanced, this brew captures the essence of the tropics in a can. Best enjoyed and shared amongst friends; after all, it takes two to mango...

Lion Brewery Co is launching our new HopBurst Series, which showcases the pure aromatic power of dry-hopping using hop oils, distilled from hops using modern technology. This ‘Citralicious’ hop oil offers a delicious citrus fruit aroma, to complement the refreshing body of this quintessential pale ale. The clincher for us is the beautifully long hoppy finish that just keeps giving. Bombs Away!

Brewed to celebrate Chinese New Year! Infused with 40kg of juicy pineapple, this playful take on the tasty and ever-popular CNY treat is bursting with pineapple tart sweetness layered on a soft biscuit-malt body, leading to a sharp, slightly dry finish. 

Soft golden yellow in colour, with a slight tinge of juicy haze, tropic like it's hot this Chinese New Year with a pint or two of refreshing goodness.

Let’s start with the most important bit: 50g of plastic (the equivalent of 5 PET bottles) is removed from the ocean with each can (or pint) that you drink. That’s thanks to our partnership with Seven Clean Seas, and is what motivated us to collab on this brew. Can’t Sea Straight is an aperitif for any time of the day, an easy ale that goes down smoother than the perfect wave, and showcases unique hops masterfully blended to make this most crushable beer. Through it, we hope to both illuminate the plight of our oceans, and inspire others to do something about it. It all starts with that first sip.

For Old Tyne's Sake is a classic Northern English Brown Ale, lovingly crafted in our local Brewlab at ThirtySix. Nutty, caramel characteristics and a slight roasty aroma permeate this beautifully restrained beer, which lets the malt do the talking. Enough of the hop bombs getting all the attention: the brown ale is probably the most underrated craft beer style, and ours has come to show off its chops. Named after the River Tyne, which flows through Newcastle, the spiritual home of this beer. Go on, have one - for Old Tyne's Sake.
Show Less

Our Sabro XPA is bittered and dry-hopped using powerful Sabro hops for a refreshing, delicious and hoppy beer. Mango and passionfruit aromas are met with smooth tangerine flavours with hints of coconut. ⁣
⁣
Brew #01 of our Single Batch brews, Sabro XPA is brewed using Kveik specialty yeast. Bright, citrusy, and made for drinking in the sunshine!

Rice is a staple in our part of the world, so why not put it in a beer? We've teamed up The Little Rice Company for the base of this brew, using their wholegrain golden rice. The result is a wonderful pearl barley aroma, chased down by a refreshing and classically crisp flavour. This light-bodied pilsner is bright as a summer's day, with a good bitterness level to finish. Easy as a walk in the Padi fields.

A collab brew is always a reason for celebration, and this Singapore-Vietnam duet between Lion Brewery Co and Ibiero brings forth a double-dry-hopped Session IPA with vivid aromas and flavours. Akin to throwing confetti into a beer, this tropical double-act offers a one-of-a-kind drinking experience for craft beer lovers of both countries.

A classic pilsner brewed for high-altitude: crisp, cold, and fresh as powder. Our Mountain Lion Pils takes inspiration from our friend Kris, who scaled Everest with a Lion Brewery Co beer in his sack and cracked it open at the summit; by all accounts, the first Lion to ever make it atop the Big Hill. Gentle bitterness and malt body, showcasing noble Saaz hops. Versatile and dangerously smashable - once you make first tracks on this, you’ll be straightlining it all day.

Happy Oktoberfest, meine Freunde! This award-winning malt-forward brew draws on the long and glorious history of this special carnival of beer. Our Festbier features Vienna and Munich malts, which impart nutty, toasty and bready notes into the rounded body. With just a touch of German hops, the beer is low in bitterness and hop aroma but extremely high in drinkability. Get all the volks together, and let’s Prost to this wonderful cultural tradition.

Slices of pumpkin, slow-roasted with a coat of cinnamon and gula melaka, until all soft and caramelised, then mashed up and dosed into a conditioning tank full of delicious beer. The result? A full-bodied, full-flavoured Halloween delight, with notes of caramel, molasses and subtle pumpkin sweetness that’s balanced by a tinge of cinnamon spice. Frightfully good.

Expression Name: Down For the Count (TapOut Collab Brew)
Official Description: Down for the Count is brewed together with our partners Tapout, in celebration of their 1-Year Anniversary. A strong and complex hop profile (Cryo Pop, Mosaic, HBC 586) with a mighty aroma and high IBUs make this a big, bold, and bright beer with a supporting cast of clean and unobtrusive malts. A statement beer to TapOut of any blues in the most enjoyable way possible.

Be honest – the name makes you want to drink it. Fit Juice, our low-alcohol and low-calorie session NEIPA, smashes it out of the park in so many ways; and unlike most low-cal beers, it actually tastes good. Showcasing loads of hops for a fruit-full aroma and flavour at an easy 3.3% ABV, it’s perfect for a daytime session that never ends. Alcoholic ‘juice’ for those with tortured consciences.

A tri-continental collab between Big Shed (AUS), Lion Brewery Co (SG) and Hakuba Brewery (JPN), this Kohia APA is a stunning beer, named after the te reo Māori word for passion flower. Thanks to Freestyle Hops’ Kohia Nelson blend, the result is a potent passionfruit aroma that brightens the beer and launches you skyward into the long white clouds. A deliciously hoppy brew that is worthy of wonder.

Our experimental take on a thirst quenching Belgian Style Witbier - a transcendent treat to beat the Singapore heat. Instead of the traditional use of Coriander Seeds and Orange Peels, we hopped up the beer with heaps of Ekuanot to tease the palette and substitute the herbal and citrus flavors. Scented with pungent spices and with a dry and airy body, this is a beer full of Wit and charm.

An homage to the grand old Belgian monastic breweries that have been making beer for over a thousand years. Light spice and clove aromas are derived from this singular Abbey yeast strain, and are complemented by plum notes, a rounded malt flavour, and a light yet firm bitterness. There is nothing quite like a Belgian Tripel, and we’ve the Trappists to thank for that. This one is right up our abbey.

Welcome to the new age! No longer is a lager just a lager, and though that might be to the chagrin of some, beers are in a better place because of it. Both Manbeer of Ren Min and Will of Lion Brewery Co went to the same high school in Indonesia, so we decided to name this collab beer in honour of our old school mascot. Our Dragon Pils is a cleanly-fermented pilsner, showcasing characteristics of beautiful HBC 586 hops. Notes of mango and orange, and a high level of sessionability.

Infamously the style of beer enjoyed by Clark Griswald during his ill-fated German Slap-Off Dance, this renowned beer is usually brewed just before the hot European summer. Back in the days when lederhosen-clad brewers faced difficulties over the summer months, breweries were a hive of activity in March, producing strong, full-bodied lagers that would keep them in stock through to October. True to tradition but regardless of season, we’ve nurtured our Märzen through a long, slow fermentation, and perfected our German accents during the 6 weeks from brewing to drinking. Prost!

Brewed in solidarity with Pravda Brewery and the people of Ukraine, 'Putin Huilo' (look it up) is a call to defiance in the face of tyranny, and has become a symbol of Ukrainian bravery against Putin’s authoritarian invasion. A strong, dry-hopped golden ale with a powerful aroma and a bittersweet flavour, it is one of Pravda Brewery’s signature brews.

A cleanly-fermented beer showcasing the characteristics of a blend of hops from the Oceania region. Our Pacific Pils is a refreshing and hop-forward pilsner, with a distinctive fresh-crushed “Mojito” citrus and lime character, and a delicate, dry malt finish. Bloody ripper mate!

Leon De Oro: The Golden Lion. Brewed with 100% English Malt - a blend of Marris Otter, Naked Oat, and a touch of Chocolate Malt for a toasty biscuit and subtle chocolate profile. Deep copper hues belie a punchy aroma of honey and ripe mango, all underpinned by a soft carbonation and creamy mouthfeel. Single hopped with El Dorado - so named for the mystical lost city of gold - this hybrid brew is a treasure just waiting to be enjoyed. Worth the Journey.

Named in honour of our unsung hero Jolly, here is an epic milk stout for the Lion masses, brewed with Kveik signature yeast, nutty dark chocolate flavours and blended with distinct malt aromas, while Chinook hops provide lightly spiced and smoky notes. Enhanced with oatmeal for a confident, full-bodied mouthfeel. Robust, creamy goodness.

Scorched Earth is the alternate (but no less dark) version of our Earth Day Brew. It is a visual representation of what we are doing to our planet, through the burning of fossil fuels and other environmentally disastrous policies. A beer as black as the hearts of oil barons, we’ve made this beer using no CO2 as we envisage a greener future across all industries - including beer. Instead, Scorched Earth is naturally cask-conditioned, and has a toasty malt aroma and low hop bitterness. We’ve also dry-hopped the casks with cacao nibs, to add a touch of coffee and chocolate the profile.

It's birthday season, and Lion Brewery Co and Smith Street Taps are celebrating their 3rd and 8th anniversaries respectively with Hops & Mischief, a collab Imperial IPA of the grandest fashion. A 9.4% behemoth that packs punchy notes of pineapple, tropical fruits, and Lifesavers, this smooth-bodied brew has a bold hoppy mouthfeel and clean, cool finish. We solemnly swear we were up to no good during the making of this beer - which is probably why it’s so damn tasty.

Jam-packed with strawberry and raspberry flavours on a doughy malt base, this pink beer is brewed for Pride month celebrations, as we stand alongside the LGBTQ+ community. A waft of strawberry upfront leads into a hint of raspberry in the body, and the tart flavours are beautifully balanced with an oh-so-soft milky finish. Here’s to everyone who feels they don’t fit into a tick-box – we see you, and we’ve brewed a fun-loving treat for all to enjoy.

Expression Name: Trailblazer - Barrel Aged Scotch Ale (Buffalo Trace Collab)
Official Description: For Lion Brewery Co’s first ever Barrel-Aged beer, we’ve crafted Trailblazer, aged in bourbon barrels from the iconic Buffalo Trace Distillery, our partners in this venture. Smooth and flavourful, this harmoniously blended dark beer has hints of vanilla and toffee, and a toasted character from the unique wood-char of the barrels. Suggestions of plums and dried fruit impress upon the palate. When heritage craft brewery meets heritage bourbon distillery, new paths are forged.

This Session IPA features two classic American IPA hops - El Dorado, with its characteristically fruity and tropical stone fruit presence; and Chinook, with its notes of zesty citrus peel and fresh pine, giving a bright lift to the pale ale malt body and finish. Almost too easy to drink.

An easy-drinking pint for easy-going people. Malty, with a soft toffee sweetness that's lovingly balanced with subtle bitterness and a touch of dry roastiness in the finish.
This Irish Red Ale uses only East Kent Golding hops during the brew, with the cask version specially dry-hopped using Fuggles. What's the Craic? Clean, smooth and a damn good time.

Tropical and creamy, our Peacher’s Pet is beery, ice cream-like deliciousness. With a luscious mouthfeel, and flavours of ripe peaches and vanilla backed up by light hoppy notes of passionfruit and spice. Our brewers have outdone themselves, and given whole new meaning to the old peaches and cream combo. This A+ treat is perfect for Singapore's endless summer. Start slurping!

The rock-n-roll sister to our classic Session NEIPA, this experimental NEIPA is smooth, silky, and electric on the tongue. As Keith Urban said, this one is made for the wildcards and wild hearts. 

Show Less

In all things, balance. Rockpools sit in the confluence between land and sea, and this brew does much the same. Mouthwatering, juicy rockmelon aromas and flavours are complemented by a refreshing saltiness - the signature of a Gose. This warm-weather favourite is kettle-soured for a tart but thirst-quenching slice of delight. Wade knee-deep in this Rockpool as you session it all day.

This hybrid honey ale is a three-way local Singaporean collabrew, between Lion Brewery Co, Lion City Meadery, and Smith Street Taps. Salted Caramel flavours tickle the tongue thanks to batched slow-caramelised honey and pink salt additions, with an umami finish that lingers and leaves you wanting more after every sip. A brilliant concoction, brought to you by masters of mischief.

You've had the Back Nine, but have you tackled the Front Nine yet? A smooth ale that's almost too easy to drink, with a different hop variety showcased in each unique cask.

Bonus points if you can identify the hop!

A local SG twist on the traditional Belgian Wit style. The creamy wheat base is complemented by the addition of Chen Pi (tangerine peel) and coupled with Osmanthus flowers and coriander seeds to enhance the beer’s wonderful aroma.

Like its Willy Wonka namesake, this precocious upstart has no regard for rules or silly things like style guidelines. Of course, we all know how that ended up for Violet ... 

This cheery beery take on Wonkas’ 3-Course Dinner Gum takes you through a veritable flavour feast of predominantly El Dorado juicy goodness, balanced with Motueka and Simcoe for the finishing courses. Marvel at its Singaporean butterfly-pea flower infused purple luminescence, shimmering with bright tropical fruit flavours, lemon-lime candy sweetness and aromas of pear, watermelon, parma violet candy and stone fruit. Juicy and bright, this is one to sip, savour and enjoy, but be wary of the Oompa Loompas coming to roll you away ...

The brainchild of our very own Joyce, who in her own words is "still looking for love in all the wrong places", Gone With De Wind is not only a pun on her last name – it's also a tropical blend of pineapple and coconut. Brewed with real pineapple juice, roasted coconut, and infused with coconut flower drops provided by our friends at Neitiv, we present to you a beery version of a Pina Colada. Extravagant and refreshing, this beer is a love story just waiting to happen.

This year's season of Cherry Blossoms inspired us to brew this Sakura Sour. A zingy, refreshing beer made with a touch of dried Sakura for the flower’s unique fragrance, alongside a generous dose of cherries. Light-bodied and low in bitterness - as cooling and enjoyable as spending an afternoon underneath a Sakura tree.

Firing away one of the most potent brews we’ve created, this hop forward lager is loaded with Zappa hops and blue pea flowers to create the strong ‘purple’ vibes. We’ve named this beer our Jericho Lager, as a stirring tribute to overcoming obstacles and rising above adversity - much like the oldest city in the world has done for thousands of years. 

Look out for an explosion of tropical fruit, mango and passion fruit aroma - with a touch of spice. Mission accomplished!

Our Steam Ale is an homage to the steam beers enjoyed by the pioneers of the American West in the 1800s. The secret to its success lies in the three C's - CTZ, Cascade, and Centennial. Dry-hopped with these signature Californian hops for strong citrus and pine flavours and a floral aroma. Amber and effervescent, Brew #06 of our Single Batch series is made with Kviek specialty yeast, and exudes hints of caramel on the finish. Uncommonly good.

This Paradise Saison is a serious indulgence of the senses. Brewed with orange peel, coriander and grains of paradise, the beer has prominent peppery characteristics alongside undertones of citrus. A trifecta of pils, wheat and rye malts add a silkiness to the bright amber body and a nice spicy zest on the finish. When the fourth pint tastes as good as the first, you know you've done something right. Fit For Royalty.

“We’re all Scotland’s story, and we’re all worth the same” (The Proclaimers, Scotland’s Story)

This year’s collaboration with the Singapore St Andrew’s Society is an appropriately North European style IPA, brewed with a touch of Viking influence from Hothead Kveik yeast. With malt and hops (rarely found in Scotland) from around the world, this is a celebration of both the Scots diaspora and those who have brought their own cultures and influences to Scotland’s story! Enjoy fresh herbal notes and hints of dried orchard fruit around the edges, with a distinct flowery, spicy, citrus-like flavour and aroma.

A refreshing clear drop that's perfect for a hot day. 

Our Spindle Press Cider is made from bittersweet apples for a bright orchard aroma and flavour, effervescent body, and a smooth, medium-sweet finish.

A taste of your younger years, our Ribes Refresher is a blackcurrant sour with a juicy body and clean, dry finish. Infused with butterfly pea flower for a unique aroma, this cumulous and smooth beer is super flavourful, with just the right amount of tartness. A serious upgrade on snakebite!

Brewed in collaboration with our good friends at Heart of Darkness, Dark Hearts Lah-ger takes our popular Brewlab favourite and gives it a good old spooky twist. Infused with a cold-steeped blend of dark malts, this dark lager (called a schwartzbier) has an opaque, black colour with smooth hints of chocolate coffee flavours, a dry, light body, and a very gentle waft of citra hops to finish. Light, balanced, dark, delicious. If you like your beers as dark as your heart, this is for you.

A single-hopped IPA infused with a rather rare breed of British hop. Bramling Cross was first harvested in 1927, and exhibits signature notes of blackberry and gooseberry, with a hint of vanilla spice. Well-attenuated, with a dry malty finish and a hoppy aroma and flavour. Thank the heavens for this classic English IPA!

For those with champagne taste, we’ve got a luxurious Brut IPA that will suit your silver-spooned palate. Tropical flavours of citrus, peach and pineapple and a hint of dankness inhibit this beer, thanks to a beautiful hop blend of Galaxy and Vic Secret; Galaxy for the tropical notes, and Vic Secret to add that touch of sultry class... If you dream of standing on the top step, here’s the beer for you. Seductively good.

This single-hopped IPA highlights Galaxy’s beautiful profile of citrus, peach, and guava. Named in tribute to the true master of the universe (move over Thanos), Buzz Lightyear, it’s a quintessential IPA with bold flavours and bitterness. Eminently crushable despite its higher ABV, you’ll be sinking pints all the way to Andromeda... and beyond.

Dewdrops is our curated collab with Neitiv, a UK-based brewery, and we are highlighting a quintessential (if somewhat unknown) Southeast-Asian ingredient: coconut flower drops. 

Coconut Palms are known as the “tree of life”, and their flower’s precious liquid brings this ‘Session IPA’ to life in extraordinary ways. Sweet, golden and coconutty, they shine atop a light malt base and are complemented by hoppy citrus notes. Delightfully refreshing, Dewdrops is a magical collaboration packed with beneficial live cultures from the inimitable coconut flower.

Released just in time for 4th of July this year, Lincoln’s Brew is a Grapefruit XPA named to honour one of the greatest American Presidents. Bright aromas characterise this uber-sessionable beer, with natural grapefruit tones and a clean, dry finish. Abe was said to have been an apples man, finding the newly discovered grapefruits of the US a bit bitter for his tastes—but we are sure this brew would have changed his mind. After all, we’ve named the damn beer after him...

A mixed fermentation, using a lager yeast and ale yeast and fermented under higher pressure, helped to create this heavenly dry-hopped pils. Notes of tangerine and grapefruit halo above a crisp pilsner base.
Show Less

A holiday cask ale to steal your heart away. Notes of nutmeg, clove and a sprinkling of cinnamon, layered over a smooth dark malt base at a refreshing ABV. Christmas in the tropics never tasted so good.

A Commonwealth Cask Ale that nods to the traditional British style, but with a modern Kiwi dry hop twist. Nectaron hops offer notes of passionfruit, peach, grapefruit, and pineapple that provide a fruity balance to the pale ale malt body and finish, while the low carbonation of this traditional ale allows the complex flavours to shine through. A new-age cask ale to savour.
Show Less

A cleanly-fermented beer showcasing the characteristic tropical, citrusy and grassy notes of Australian Ella hops. Our Ella Pils is brewed with a neutral malt base, which provides the balance for this drinkable, refreshing, and hop-forward pilsner. Medium body, velvety soft mouthfeel and dry finish. How bloody good!

Our alcoholic Ginger Beer uses locally sourced ginger, gently pressed to extract the essence of the root’s flavour and aroma. Blended with sun-dried raisins for a balanced sweetness, and fermented with both beer and champagne yeasts, this zingy new brew is the antidote to a sticky IPA. Fizzy, boozy, and fantastic. 
Show Less

An easy-drinking pint for easy-going people. Dearg is 'Red' in Gaelic, and this is a Nitro Irish Red that's malty with a soft toffee sweetness, lovingly balanced with subtle bitterness and a touch of dry roastiness in the finish.
Clean and smooth, we are sure you're going to love our Dearg Ale - even if you don't know how to pronounce the name.

This blood orange beauty is named in honour of our Jet, and mirrors some of their best traits - vibrant, full of zest and fabulous. Leaving On A Jet Plane is an intense sight to behold, but looks can be deceiving – what we’ve got here is a very clean beer base, paired with blood orange and a shot of beetroot for a slightly sweet-sour aftertaste. Trust us - you'll absolutely fly through it.

A Braggot is a traditional beer-mead hybrid that’s been enjoyed since the 12th century, and we wanted to share this stellar union. A marriage of honey and malt that is delicately flavoured with light malts, its sweetness counterbalanced by pine and grapefruit bitterness from Cascade hops. Infused with two strains of honey: Longan flower, and the spectacular wild Ziziphus Blossom honey - supplied by our local partners BeeAmazed. Nectar of the Gods.

After the scorching sun baked and dried out these chillies, we dosed a few handful of them into our Pils to push the boundaries of our craft. Singapore is synonymous with heat, and our Api Pils celebrates that; with its spicy flavours, and the fact that it's perfect for a hot day. The aroma of the red peppers makes for a refreshing change from the usual hop bouquet, and tiny tendrils of heat linger on an otherwise crisp finish. Die die must try.

Brewed in collaboration with the famous St. Andrew’s Society Singapore, we’ve got ourselves a Wee Heavy of a beer, indeed! Malt-forward, with delicious hints of caramel notes and a full and robust mouthfeel, this beer will have you dreaming of the highlands of Alba. Gie it laldy and get it down ya!

Available on draught and in cask.
Dry-hopped Lager

‘Tis the season to make merry, and Lion Brewery Co x Archipelago Brewery have teamed up for the perfect festive brew. Together, we've concocted a refreshing, beautifully balanced Kolsch imbued with a bit of Christmas magic. Spruced with noble hops and Norwegian Kveik yeast (cultivated by ol’ Nick himself), the low-malt body and signature Kölsch sweetness are tinged with that unique Cranberry flavour. This beer is sure to get you in the holiday spirit, especially when paired with our Christmas specials. We won’t judge you if you dip your turkey into it...

Lion Brewery Co & Sunbird Brewing Co have come together to bring you a Gose with the heart of Singapore and the soul of the snow-capped Kunlun Mountains. Deep gold-coloured with a medium-low body, the hero of this beer is undoubtedly the Snow Chrysanthemum, which exudes floral notes and a delicious aroma of kumquat to compliment its earthy, tart taste. A symbol of hope and unity, this Gose is a friend to all - in keeping with the great friendship shared by our two breweries.

Our cask version of Bramling Cross IPA, Merlin’s Staff is infused with a rather rare breed of British hop. Bramling Cross was first harvested in 1927, and exhibits signature notes of blackberry and gooseberry, with a hint of vanilla spice. Well-attenuated, with a moderate dry finish and a hoppy aroma and flavour. Thank the heavens for this classic English cask ale!

A modern, Singapore variation on the most popular beer style in the world. Crafted with only Pilsner malt and a smattering of Carahell, our Lah-Ger presents a dry, light body with a lingering bitterness, and that oh-so-delicate waft of Citra dry-hops in the finish. Light, balanced and delicious.

Take a sip, close your eyes, and listen to the waves lapping the shore on a faraway island: it’s the closest you’re going to get to travelling anywhere for now. The aromatics of tropical fruit, citrus and berries feel like warm sun on your face, the full malt body as comforting as sand between your toes, and the lingering bitterness gently rests on your taste buds like a beautiful sunset over the sea. Paradise in the palm of your hands.

Imagine a tropical, ice-cream-like beer with flavours of ripe peaches and vanilla. Then add nitro, and enjoy the creamiest of creamy IPAs: our Pastel Milkshake masterpiece. Super-smooth and pleasantly hoppy, with notes of passionfruit and light spice thanks to the addition of Zappa hops. A dreamy peach of a beer.

A classic Pacific Coast IPA, but not necessarily the coast you’d immediately think of (it’s a big ocean). Using East Coast Australia and New Zealand hops and malts, we’ve crafted a uniquely Antipodean take on the style. Hardy bitterness at the start and late kettle additions creates a flavour (with a u) that's bursting in tropical and citrus tones, while the medium-light maltiness pulls it all together in harmony.

Cloudy Day is the unfiltered version of our classic Straits Pale Ale. A seasonal take on one of our best-loved beers, it’s got an even more pronounced Citra hop aroma and the same clean, dry finish. After the intense heat in Singapore over these past few weeks, I think we could all do with a Cloudy Day!

A local SG twist on the traditional Belgian Wit style. The creamy wheat base is complemented by the addition of Chen Pi (tangerine peel) and coupled with Osmanthus flowers and coriander seeds to enhance the beer’s wonderful aroma.

Brewed in partnership with Deadman Brewery in Hong Kong, this pilsner is a light, hop-bright brew for endless summers. Notes of red fruits linger above a smooth pils malt base in what is a crushable beer, made for cruising through the afternoon and well into the evening.

Don’t be deceived by its relaxed ABV - this beer is loud and proud, with a beautifully hoppy kick. Brewed for every occasion and every colour of the rainbow, it’s a beer we can all enjoy as equals - and that’s the main message of our Stay Proud Session Ale.

A local twist on the traditional Belgian Wit style. A creamy wheat base, complemented by the addition of chen pi (Tangerine peel – the whole fruit is traditionally gifted to bring good fortune), coupled with osmanthus flowers to sweeten the aroma with a touch of apricot.

Lion Brewery Co are diving into the world of NFTs with this beer collab with Hola Mona, founded by leading Singapore artists. Together, we've come up with a beer to celebrate the wild new frontier of crypto and non-fungible tokens. This red-hued Rosella Lager is a fittingly unique brew, with rosé aromas tinged with jasmine blossoms. Mild sweetness is followed by slightly sour notes and an almost-imperceptible bitterness, and rosella tea flavours linger on the finish. This beautiful infusion of local botanicals celebrates the Singapore art scene in bold strokes. Scan the QR code to Mint your own Mona!

Inspired by a recipe handed down by our brewer's mum, this beer is a tribute to the history of Anzac Biscuits. From the first waft of the golden syrup-laced coconut aroma to the biscuit finish, this ale delivers exactly what's on the tin. Lashings of oats, golden syrup and coconut makes this exactly like Anzac Biscuits have been crumbled into the beer. Mum would have been proud.

A richly malty brew, with significant caramel notes and hints of roasted malt. We’ve toned down hop flavours and bitterness in our Wee Heavy to allow the malts to shine, though you’ll detect some shaded notes of plums, raisins and dried fruit. Named in honour of Scottish football’s famous travelling fans, known to enjoy a pint or two... Aye, enjoy it.
Light and crushable, with just the right touch of mixed berry notes and a super-clean finish.

Brewed for those who are here for a good time AND a long time. They say balance is the key to happiness, and this beer is a true mid-strength at 3.5% ABV, enhanced by a hoppy aroma. Keep calm and carry on with this session ale for your ultimate enjoyment.

Drink Category: IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy
Official Description:
Presenting our first New England-style Double IPA! We started 2023 with a Baby Step Hazy Session IPA and we’re now taking a Big-ish Leap into the world of NE DIPAs. We've opted to slightly throttle back the ABV while kicking the flavour train into high gear. 

Generously dry-hopped with Citra and El Dorado hops; get set for an explosion of bold aromas and flavours. Expect a predominant presence of lively grapefruit and citrus notes, all nestled within a delightful backdrop of stone fruit accents.

We loaded this mango smoothie IPA with – what else? – heaps of fresh mango puree. Rounded out with just the right amount of lactose and dry-hopped with Sabro and Citra hops, this is a lip-smacker of creamy tropical fruit flavour.

Family Ties is part of the Future Now! Series, our response to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic and the fundamental joys in life that it has temporarily taken from us.

We love New England-style beers or hazies. Not just easy on the eyes, they’re full flavoured, extremely easy to drink and perfect for the tropics. However, we want to take the style up a notch and take your palate on a flavour romp!

This Pomelo Hazy Pale Ale smashes together Citra hops with freshly pressed pomelo, amplifying those delightful and refreshing sweet-tangy pomelo flavours. Close your eyes and let each sip transport you to a sun-kissed orchard. At 4.8% ABV, you can indulge in this succulent treat all day.

The Citra hop is the result of crossing two unknown hop varieties. At the beginning, this hybrid, or 'bâtard' of a hop, was not a popular child. Over time, brewers grew to love its muscular citrus flavors that not only helped popularize IPAs but also made it the most widely grown hop.

For this Double Dry-Hopped IPA, we doubled down on Citra, using it as the sole hop with late additions of Cryo Citra to maximize those amazing flavors and aromas. There's a strong citrus aroma to start, which then transitions into punchy notes of grapefruit and tropical fruit. This beer is thick and muscular; its citrus on steroids so buckle up.

Take off for a dreamy journey through pillowy clouds of tropical flavour in this classic New England-style IPA. Dry-hopped with fresh Citra and Talus hops, this hazy, fruit-forward ale radiates a bouquet of citrusy aromas.

Cloud Chasing is part of the Future Now! Series, our response to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic and the fundamental joys in life that it has temporarily taken from us.

Pomelo Creamsicle marks our debut into the world of Oat Cream IPAs, a style that holds a special place in our hearts. In crafting this brew, we've added freshly pressed pomelo, a delicate touch of lactose, and an ample dose of our favourite hops. Prepare for a pomelo flavour explosion that sweeps gracefully across your palate, adorned with subtle notes of stone fruit, all harmoniously underpinned by a delightful veil of creamy sweetness.

Ride a euphoric wave of tropical aroma in this hazy ale showcasing a fruity mix of Idaho 7, Citra, and Azacca hops. This all-day IPA delivers the full, satisfying flavours of a bigger IPA in a smaller, more sessionable package.

Crowdsurfing is part of the Future Now! Series, our response to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic and the fundamental joys in life that it has temporarily taken from us.

Our latest Hazy IPA is hopped with the much-celebrated experimental varieties: HBC 586 and Superdelic. “Bubblelicious Burst” is a whimsical journey to the carefree days of our childhood, where Jolly Ranchers, Skittles, Airheads, and Ice Pops weren’t just treats but staples of our diets! 

Superdelic hops shine, exuding delicious flavours of passion fruit and red berries, while HBC 586 complements with hints of mango and lychee, creating a tropical fruit hard candy sensation.

A DDH Kveik IPA stuffed with an explosive amount of Riwaka hops. What the hell are Riwaka hops? They're like Saaz hop's cool, badass cousin, with almost double the total oils of Saaz, which means you're in for a real treat. 

This beer is a sensory overload of intense, mouth-watering flavours of citrus and grapefruit. And when you stick your nose in, those fragrant Riwaka hops will punch you in the face with their incredible aroma. So, go ahead, take a mouthful, and let that juice bomb detonate.

Mango Haze, our second fruited Hazy Pale Ale, smashes together our favourite medley of hops with freshly pressed mango. Prepare to be captivated by an alluring burst of ripe mango aroma. As you gingerly take your first sip, a graceful tango unfolds, where the sweet mango and tropical fruit notes from the hops dance in delicious harmony. Sit back and savour its every nuance.

Hit the bottom of the juice barrel? 'Sticky Greens' is set to reboot your taste buds. Hopped with classic Columbus and Centennial hops as well as Cryo Mosaic and Citra; this West Coast IPA squeezes every bit of aroma and flavour from the hops’ essential oils and resins. 

Each sip introduces a distinctly dry and dank character, which then unfolds into layers of piney, resinous and citrus flavours. A lingering bitterness ties all the flavours together, creating a balance that is both nostalgically familiar and refreshingly modern.

Legend has it that the way to measure an object’s volume dawned on Archimedes of Syracuse while he bathed. In his excitement, the Greek mathematician leaped from the water, shouted “εὕρηκα!” and ran naked through the streets to share his discovery.

In our quest to develop a dry, crisp, and refreshing everyday beer, we found our own eureka moment in the humble grisette, a citrusy farmhouse ale once produced for miners in Belgium’s Hainaut province. Brewed with a four-grain blend, a mix of Saaz, Magnum, and Nelson Sauvin hops, fresh orange peel, and pink peppercorns, Eureka pays tribute to sun-kissed Syracuse, Sicily, home to our friends at Birrificio Alveria, where we brewed this summery ale.

Imagine sitting in a room bursting with hops, thoughtfully experimenting with countless combinations for our next brew. Suddenly, it hits us: a harmonious sequence of four hops, simple yet impactful. This unique medley – Amarillo, Mosaic Cryo, Nectaron, and Nelson Sauvin – resonated with us deeply. Just as many pop songs are famously crafted from the same four chords, this beer is our ‘Four Hop Wonder’. 

A hybrid between a Hazy IPA and a West Coast IPA. It has highs of passion fruit and stone fruit, but it's harmoniously balanced with a gentle rhythm of earthy and floral undertones. There's also a soft hum of bitterness playing in the background that holds it all together. It's a straightforward blend, yet undeniably memorable – a testament to simplicity's power.

Baby Steps is our first beer brewed in Singapore! IT'S the culmination of many baby steps forward (not to mention, many steps back during Covid). We've brewed beers in Italy, Vietnam, UK and Australia, so to be able to brew at home is a major milestone for us. 

We set out to brew a New England IPA that's full-flavoured yet sessionable, and a perfect respite from the heat. Baby Steps delivers on all of that in spades! Hopped exclusively with delicious Mosaic hops; this beer is a heady mix of punchy citrus and tropical flavours with floral and earthy berry aromas.

Making beer is fun but, ultimately, we’re a small business. We constantly face new challenges and you always feel that there’s trouble around the corner that might shut us down. Fortunately, we brew beers that we love to drink.

So when work is tough, we take a load off with No Stress - a juice bomb brewed with Norwegian Hornidal Kveik yeast and hopped with Citra and Nectaron hops. You’ll love the punchy citrus and tropical fruit flavours (with hints of pineapple and peach)!

This beer is inspired by Aunt Shelley, who is larger than life, fierce and loving. In her own words, she’s an everyday mom, campaigning for inclusion and respect for her son and the LGBTIQ community. This is an understatement; she’s gone toe-to-toe with the Aussie government many times, and helped bring real change. 

Like Shelley, this Hazy Session IPA is vivacious and fierce. It offers the bold flavour of a full- strength hazy despite its modest 4.8% ABV. Its Citra and Motueka dry-hop blend entices the taste buds with notes of ripe tropical fruit and zesty tangerine.

Hopped generously with Citra and Lupomax Citra, Summer Pop offers a rejuvenating respite from the sweaty, messy, and humid summer heat. Bursting with vibrant citrus aromas, this beer features tropical fruit and botanical flavours amplified by a dry finish.

This New England-style Pale Ale resembles a light, citrusy G&T accented with fresh cucumber. As the temperatures climb, let Summer Pop quench your thirst!
Show Less

For this NE Pale Ale, we dialled up the use of Nelson Sauvin hops to the max. The hop is named after the Sauvignon Blanc grape. We wanted to let those grape-esque notes of the hop sing out loud and clear. 

But the chorus doesn’t just stop there, there’s also little hits of key lime and passionfruit playing in the background. This isn’t just a beer; it's our ode to Nelson.

A re-imagining of our first brew in Singapore: Baby Steps! We took the original and replaced the garden-variety Mosaic hops with its juiced-up cousin - Cryo Mosaic. These are no ordinary hops; Cryo extracts and distills the very soul of the hop, which is lupulin.

The result is like a taste explosion in your mouth. It's a mad symphony of amplified and intensified tropical flavours, crescendoing with pronounced, rebellious notes of pine and tangerine. We're not just tweaking flavours. It's not even a Baby Step; it's a bold, swaggering Tiny Leap forward in the endless pursuit of the sublime in brewing.

Singapore and New Zealand, vastly different in land mass but with almost the same population size. No wonder both countries keep wooing each other. Officially, both countries have an “Enhanced Partnership”, which we guess, is diplomatic speak for a “situationship”. We, on the other hand, are not afraid to declare our love and go all in. 

Welcome to our New Zealand IPA hopped exclusively with New Zealand hops: Nectaron, Riwaka and Motueka. It's a full-bodied symphony, bursting with tropical fruit notes as well as floral and fresh herb flavours. Finishes with a subtle note of zesty lemon. We call it 'Kia ora', a Maori nod to a brew that's all about the welcome.

Inspired by the Chinese phenomenon of 'lying flat' (Tang Ping 躺平), Tang Ping is more than just a Hazy Pale Ale; it's a lifestyle choice. In a world rushing after material success, we extend an invitation to you: to step back, relax, and find joy in the simpler pleasures of life.

Dry-hopped with Riwaka, you'll relish the vibrant burst of grapefruit aromas. Each sip reveals a delicious cascade of juicy citrus, passionfruit, and tropical notes. So, we invite you to log off, silence your notifications, and savour a pint.

Expression Name: 一见钟情 Quadruple Fruited Gose: Mulberry, Raspberry, Golden Berry & Passion Fruit
Official Description:
一见钟情 Yī Jiàn Zhōng Qíng, translating to 'Love at First Sight', names our beloved series of fruited sours. These creations are our labour of love, capturing our fervour for crafting beers that delight and entertain in equal measure.

This deep red hue Quadruple Fruited Gose is brewed with a lavish blend of mulberries, raspberries, golden berries, and passion fruit. It greets you with a vibrant tartness that tantalizes the senses, followed by a rich mosaic of flavours. Ripe berries mingle with hints of citrus and a subtle sweetness. This tropical delight truly epitomizes love at first taste.

We love New England-style beers, or hazies. Not only are they a feast for the eyes, but they're also rich in flavour, supremely quaffable, and an ideal match for tropical climates. We're elevating this style to new heights, aiming to take your taste buds on an exhilarating flavour journey!

Brewed with freshly pressed cantaloupe, the juicy melon sweetness is perfectly balanced by our favourite blend of hops. This Cantaloupe Hazy Pale Ale is a cool, creamy tropical escape, offering a delicious reprieve from the sweltering heat and humidity.

Tiny King – a Hazy Session IPA that delivers a royal flavour experience within a more-ish, easy-drinking 4.8% ABV package. No expense was spared, we lavishly hopped the brew with 9 kg of HBC 586, Riwaka, and Centennial, ensuring each sip is fit for a king.

Boasting a juicier impact and a meaningful mouthfeel, Tiny King presents an inviting bright citrus aroma with hints of grassiness. It then invites you to ascend the throne of flavour, where the lush landscapes of guava, citrus, and lychee await. So, raise your chalice and toast to Tiny King’s reign!

The West Coast of the US is synonymous with significant parts of pop culture. If you’ve been to SoCal, it's not surprising it laid the foundations for the West Coast hip hop scene and the West Coast IPA. There's nothing quite like slamming back a dank and hoppy West Coast IPA with a background soundtrack of West Coast hip hop legends like Pharcyde, Ice Cube, and Dr. Dre.

This beer is our tribute to the SoCal scene, dreams, and vibes. SoCal Thirst is our modern take on a classic style. Hopped with Amarillo, Centennial, and Citra that results in an aromatic blend of pine, citrus, and floral notes. It boasts prominent grapefruit and stone-fruit flavours that are deliciously balanced by a satisfyingly firm bitter finish.

There are times when your palate is just Over It. Your palate does not want a full frontal assault of hops or to be kicked like a mule. But you also don’t want something that is dull as dishwater.

Over It has a clean, refreshing smoothness that’ll make you forget the daily grind, and a subtle bite of freshly crushed citrus from the dry-hopping of Motueka that will tickle your taste buds. There’s deliciousness and enjoyment in simplicity, and with an 4.6% ABV you won’t be able to resist the urge for another round.

Remember MySpace Tom? He was the OG Zuckerberg. Let's cast our minds back to a simpler era before the social media hellscape that now includes Tik Tok, Instagram, Snapchat, and the rest. Life was much simpler; all you had were Friendster and MySpace. Back then, Tom was everyone's first friend on MySpace.

Like MySpace Tom, our first Pilsner not only wants to befriend everyone but also be your first friend. With its classic noble aroma, this clean and crisp Pilsner comes with a mild bitter-sweet finish. Especially on a scorching hot day, MySpace Tom will quench your thirst for connection.

We’re on a quest to master the fundamentals and achieve perfection in simplicity, aiming to create the most delicious Golden Ale. 'Over It' was our initial attempt, which was dry-hopped with Mouteka. In our latest iteration, we have made adjustments to the yeast and hops.

This Dry-Hopped Golden Ale features Nelson Sauvin hops, imparting herbaceous aromas and delightful flavours of gooseberries. It serves as a refreshing and crisp respite from the heat, akin to a Summer Snack in a pint. 

The beer is exceptionally smooth, offering just the right amount of flavour to tantalise your taste buds.

Introducing the third version of our Golden Ale for 2023, now brewed with a divine twist! This Dry-Hopped Golden Ale features Nectaron hops. The name 'Nectaron' combines 'Nectar of the Gods' with the first name of the hop's breeder, Ron Beatson.

At a smooth 4% ABV, it's wonderfully gentle on the palate, offering a burst of tropical flavour that's perfectly balanced with just a hint of bitterness. Could this beer be the Gods' Golden Nectar? We like to think so — the Gods' favourite tipple from dawn until dusk!

Expression Name: Nǐ Pà Hēi Ma? 你怕黑吗?
Official Description:
“Nǐ Pà Hēi Ma? 你怕黑吗?” translates to “Are You Afraid of the Dark?”, and is a throwback to George Lam's infamous Guinness ad. This is a milk stout loaded with real vanilla beans and a touch of lactose. Smooth and creamy, yet not overly decadent. 

It’s like diving into a pool of melted velvety dark chocolate marshmallows with hints of coffee. Brewed for drinkability, this stout is comforting and downright satisfying—perfect for those who aren’t afraid of venturing into the dark.

Originating from Bavaria, German-style Helles lagers are celebrated for their pale golden hue. Our Helles is affectionately named Bái Fù Měi 白富美, which translates to 'white, rich, and good-looking'.

Bái Fù Měi boasts a full-bodied yet crisp and clean taste, with each sip flirting with sweetness to perfectly balance the subtle undercurrent of light bitterness. Bái Fù Měi isn't just a good-looking Helles; it's a charismatic charmer that captivates from the first sip.

Introducing Heaps Chocka Hazy IPA – a brew that's overflowing with flavour! Inspired by Kiwi slang for "lots" and "full to the brim," this beer is packed with tons of New Zealand hops and fermented with Verdant Yeast from that infamous British brewery (IYKYK). A balanced malt character lets an aroma of ripe tropical fruits and earthy hoppiness take centre stage.

We’ve crammed this IPA with Riwaka and Motueka hops, delivering a dominant flavour of freshly cut grassy citrus with a subtle undertone of zesty lime and lemon. Get ready to experience a beer that’s truly heaps chocka with flavour!

Meet Juice Du Jour, an aromatic and enticing New England IPA. Brewed with Kveik yeast and hopped with Mosaic, Nectar, and HBC 586 hops, it delivers an exquisite tropical fruit bouquet. 

Each sip offers a burst of fresh citrus and stone fruit flavours, a sophisticated treat for those discerning hopheads. But, for real, this is just another juice of the day—it's a juicplosion that'll rock the palates of the masses!

This Golden Ale is dry-hopped with Superdelic hops from New Zealand. Our objective was drinkability, making Superdelic Sip an exceptionally smooth and refreshingly light beer.

Delicately dry-hopped, a touch of red fruit, citrus, and tropical flavours will gently embrace your palate without overpowering it. Plus, with an easy-going 4% ABV, the good times will keep rolling sip after sip.

We Want Hoppy, a modern West Coast IPA with a neutral malt profile that lets the hops dominate. Dank, piney aromas lead to layers of grapefruit, passion fruit, and floral flavours, ending in a clean, punchy bitterness.

Expression Name: 艳红 Yànhóng Sixtuple Parfait Sour
Official Description:
艳红 Yànhóng Sixtuple Parfait Sour, named for its 'bright red' hue, showcases an extravagant blend of cantaloupe, dragon fruit, mango, passion fruit, pineapple, and raspberry. The vibrant red from the dragon fruit and raspberry makes it as visually stunning as it is delicious. 

Each sip invites your palate on an adventure, unveiling a new layer in a parfait of tropical flavors. The additions of lactose and the yeast’s lively acidity create a Smoothie Gose that's creamy with a refreshingly sweet, tart finish.

Easy-going and juicy, Lil' Ren Hazy Pale Ale is your all-day, sunny, succulent sipper. Heavy dry-hopping imparts lush aromas of ripe tropical fruits and rich flavours of citrus and stone fruits, ending with subtle lemony notes.

SALTY, SOUR, SWEET!

Bringing back a 2019 bestseller is back to rock your 2023!

Pine, Citrus, Pithy

We celebrate Singapore's Hawkers and their tireless toil for a well-fed nation with a thirst quencher to help beat the heat and wash a meal down. If it's good for them, it's good for you. Yumseng!

KOPI O IN A PINT!

The Singaporean daily cuppa reimagined. Fragrant roast meets smooth chocolatey drinkability in this pint-sized deliciousness. A proper treat for the senses.

Aside from making a thirst-quenching treat for the senses, these fruits are auspicious symbols of Prosperity and Love, stuff that Orh Gao (and all of us) could use as we meander the year of 2023 and onwards.

Zesty, Fresh, Balanced.

Again Again connects like a proper fist bump. It's groovy, brings people together, and you could definitely go for another again, again. A zesty and fresh go-to pale ale with a malty base, Again Again harmonises the beer's firm malty character and its fresh orange and grapefruit hoppiness. ????

A collaboration beer that pours exclusively at Tanuki Raw Cross Street Exchange!

Can easy-drinking beer get any better? We asked the question, and the brewers from That Singapore Beer Project got into action, melding the crispness of a Pilsner with the citrus-charged aromas from American hops. Great as your first beer; complementary with delicate or rich dishes; and refreshing enough to be your 11th one-for-the-road, be the first to try Easy Tanuki, an all-purpose session IPA that continues to deliver.

A hybrid style taking a juicy NEIPA and souring it to give it a tangy undercurrent.
Hazy pale gold. Citrus and tropical fruit aromas. Medium mouthfeel is cut by the tangy juiciness that finishes moreish and super refreshing.

Get on the right line. Bust the right moves. And gear up for P1 with Slipstream, an experimental Brut IPA brewed with the all new Fermentis DA-16 yeast.

Generously hopped with Mosaic and El Dorado, the beer lights up your palate with a white wine-like profile packed with tropical fruit nuances. Well tuned with crackery malt-sweetness and a firm, moderate bitterness, count on slipstream to impress from start till finish.

WORK HARD, PLAY HARD

PROFILE: Grapefruit, Cereal, Uplifting

It doesn't matter if you work off the table, ladder, and/or chair. The Table Ladder Chair is a refreshing, post-work Kölsch that enhances the taste of sweet escape on a hard day's night.

Pine, Tropical, Citrus

2023 probably feels sweet enough still so all y'all need's a little bit of luck to cruise through. Supposedly Double Luck's fun-sized and friendlier brother, this juicy session IPA drops pine for more citrus juiciness. We could all use a little bit of luck today!

Resiny | Luscious | Juicy

As part of our 1st year anniversary celebratory beer series, we took the best of both worlds; West Coast IPA & New England style IPA; and went big to create our interpretation of a modern Hazy Double IPA.

Utilizing Norwegian Espe Kveik yeast, we were able to capture the sweet essence of pear, melon, berries & lychee, and accompanied with layers of resiny mouthfeel of grapefruit & citrus rind.

Its refreshingly balanced juicy & tart mouthfeel is finished with peach & melon nuances, and wisp of rambutan and watermelon from the Galaxy hops.

Brewed with pilsner, rye & wheat malt, fresh hops, sweet Osmanthus & dried Kumquat, this farmhouse ale emulates subtle notes of floral & earthy aromas, & finished with a complex & tart mouthfeel.

Brewed for Good Luck Beerhouse's second anniversary. A tart refreshing Gose with blackberries, accented with salty umeboshi plums.

The Spiced Mead is our homage to the masala chai materialised in a beer style mead at 5.5% ABV. We took spices like Cinnamon, Cloves and Star Anise, roasted them whole and fermented them together with our custom blend of eucalyptus honey. This clear blonde mead will pleasantly surprise you with its taste profile and complex long finish. Like the rest of our brews, the Spiced mead is brewed from all natural ingredients with no additives, artificial flavouring or colouring. Highly recommended to be savoured chilled and in a glass.

A dark crimson, floral, berry-flavoured mead in a beer style at 5.5% ABV. We’ve steeped whole dried hibiscus flowers to extract the flavour and colour into a tea, and ferment it with our custom blend of eucalyptus honey. We then finish off the mead with both, whole-crushed and pureed blueberries. The result is a tannin-rich, floral mead with a dry wine-like finish that is excellent with any meal consisting of red meat. As with all our meads, the Hibiscus Blueberry is made from natural ingredients with no additives, artificial sweeteners or colouring. Lovely in both sight and taste.

The Classic Mead is our interpretation of a beer-style mead at 5.5% ABV. Designed to be session-able, it is refreshing, crisp and tart with prominent notes from the custom blend of eucalyptus honey that we’ve developed in conjunction with australian apiaries. Made from all natural ingredients with no additives, artificial flavouring or colouring, the Classic is the perfect companion to food that is big on both flavour and grease. Best enjoyed chilled on a hot singaporean-like sunny day.

LCM's very first seasonal mead is greatly inspired by how asian grandmothers brew chrysanthemum tea. They would boil large quantities of dried chrysanthemum blooms in water to extract the full flavour of the flowers, and then sweeten the flower tea while still boiling, with rock sugar.

We have adopted that same approach with this very special mead. High grade dried chrysanthemum flowers that were specifically graded for use in tea were sourced for this seasonal. We steeped and boiled the chrysanthemums in water, substituted rock sugar with our proprietary blend of honey and fermented the mixture into mead.

The second seasonal mead in our "Liang-teh" series is our homage to the Longan Red-date Tea.

In an attempt to preserve as much of the original flavours as possible, we raided the chinese medical halls for dried red-dates and dried longans that were specifically graded for aroma and sweetness. We steeped and boiled everything, added our proprietary blend of honey and fermented the mixture into this mead. What we have is a slightly hazy blonde mead with a strong notes of red dates on the nose with hints of dried longans. The sweetness of the red dates are balanced off by the honey, followed by the warm sweetness with a slight acidity from the dried longans and the honey.

Finished at 7% ABV, this mead is great for all day drinking. Like all our seasonal meads, this is a one-off brew in limited quantity and only available while stocks last

Milkberry is a vanilla milk stout that even non-dark beer drinkers will love it! The addition of lactose, allows the beer to be have a mellow sweetness and roundness of body. The subtle vanilla finish makes the stout to the the best comfort drink at anytime of the day.

From a scientific perspective, the key property of lactose is that it is non-fermentable. Whereas brewing yeasts consume simple sugar such as glucose to create two essential components of beer (alcohol and carbon dioxide gas for carbonation), they cannot consume lactose. We have full control of the sweetness without heightening the level of alcohol nor carbonation.

A deliciously smooth ale inspired by the Singaporean breakfast. Brewed with pandan, gula melaka and coconut. Also two kilos of real toast were added during the brewing process. Roasty, malty and recommended with soft boiled eggs.

This is a complex beer both taste and aroma. You will smell coffee, vanilla and brown sugar. Your first sip you will realized the abundance of malts overtake the hops in a balanced way. There is a rich boozy beer that tastes of apricot, dried spice with a hint of oak as it was conditioned on oak for 4 months. It has a chewy consistency and high sipability due to the 10.1% ABV. Do not pour and drink a pint unless you are insane! Yet this is an excellent example of a beer to be enjoyed on a cold Russian night.

Drink Category: Homebrew, IPA - Black / Cascadian Dark Ale
Official Description: This Black IPA is black has a think light brown head. When smelling the aroma it will smell sweet but with the low FG it is due to the Chinook hops. Your first sips you will taste the Chinook and Cascade hops over the malts. Later you will taste the Black Patent malts that produce the mouthfeel you don’t expect in a typical IPA but this is a BIPA. Some will notice a very slight burnt taste after a few sips. This wonderfully balanced highly drinkable Black IPA meets all of the BIPA criteria.
